metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Finance and National Planning
parts: (a) whether there are any economic planners in rural districts, countrywide;
(b) if so, how they collaborate with other stakeholders in enhancing social and economic development; and
(c) what measures are being taken to enhance the collaboration with other stakeholders.
(a) when the Government will operationalise dip tanks that were constructed in 2013 and 2014 in Chadiza Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) how many dip tanks await operationlisation;
(c) what the cause of the delay in operationalising the dip tanks is; and
(d) what the total cost of constructing the dip tanks was.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Arts
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a community sports development centre in Mbabala Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure an additional dredger to service the main habour at Chilubi Island in Chilubi District;

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct border posts at the following crossing points between Zambia and Malawi to prevent smuggling:
(i) Kenyelere/Hebe; and (ii) Mbala Chanda/Chama;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to revamp agricultural training centres, countrywide; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a trades and skills training centre in Kanchibiya Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) if there are no such plans, why. 7. QUESTION FOR WRITTEN ANSWER (STANDING ORDER 81) W6. Mr Chewe (Lubansenshi) - to ask the Minister of Finance and National Planning:
(a) how many commercial banks were wholly or co-owned by the Government and other stakeholders, as of December, 2023;
(b) how much revenue each bank generated during the period 2020 to 2023, year by year;
(c) in which districts, the banks were operating from;
(d) whether there are any plans to encourage Government institutions to save with the banks at (a) in order to enhance their profitability;
(e) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and

(f) if there are no such plans, why. 8. NOTICE OF MOTION Ms Chonya Adopt Report of the Committee on National Guidance and Gender Matters: That this House adopts the Report of the Committee on National Guidance and Gender Matters on the Review of the Gender-Based Violence Responses and Programming in Zambia vis-à-vis Establishment of Victims’ Shelters, Fast Track Courts and the Anti-Gender-Based Violence Fund, for the Third Session of the Thirteenth National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on Wednesday, 12th June, 2024. 9.
